result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Jones Lockhart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs), 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 5 days (5-13-2015 to 5-18-2015) time served.
Probation conditions apply except for house time condition.

miscConds.notes:
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of proabtion will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.

- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- AODA evaluation, and any additional AODA treatment recommended by Department Of Corrections. 
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release work, inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey Jones Lockhart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
2/11/16 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.

Defendant Corey Jones Lockhart in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Paul Michael Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 days (5-13-2015 to 05-18-2015) time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME in the House of Correction without goodtime credit;release work, inmate work assignments at the House of correction. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Imposed and stayed. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- AODA evaluation, and any additional AODA treatment recommended by Department Of Corrections. 
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 business days/72 hours of receiving prescription from medical professional.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain full time employment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of proabtion will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 02-04-2016 received and filed.
Sentencing documents from Attorney Reddin date 01-28-2016, received and filed. tk

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 02-05-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Court vacated jury trial scheduled on 01-13-2016.

Defendant Corey Jones Lockhart in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 Case set for motion hearing. Motion hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Cassandra Benitez, Officer, Milwaukee Police Department. Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by state and defense. Finding of fact and legal analysis. Court denied defense Motion. Case proceeded to plea hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Memorandum in Support of Defendat's Motin to Suppress Evidence, received and filed. tk
State's Response to Defendatn's Stop Motion received and filed. tk

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services violation report: positive drug test, received and filed. KAR
Court will take no action.

Defendant Corey Jones Lockhart in court with attorney William Joseph Reddin.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.
Defense counsel requests case be set for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial.  Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order to be signed and filed.  Copies to be given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial Conference on 1/5/16 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial scheduled on 1/13/16 at 9:00 am in Branch 17.  Final pre-trial and motion hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence dated October 15, 2015 received and filed.  Copies distributed to parties.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report dated October 22, 2015 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Bail Refund Packets
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/28/2015.  vp

All conditions remain the same, which include:
-  JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
- Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
- Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court modified bail from $5,000.00 to $2000.00 cash with all conditions to remain the same. $3,000.00 that was posted shall be returned to the person who posted.
Court granted request for new counsel. Attorney Reddin will resume as attorney of record. Order signed and filed. Case proceeded to bail hearing.
